availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
City and County of Philadelphia } SS

I, Hugh W. Tener appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky by Commission bearing date the 20th day of May A.D. 1861, a Commissioner to take the acknowledgment of Deeds &C in the State of Pennsylvania to be used or recorded in the State of Kentucky -- do swear -- that I will well and truly Execute and perform all the duties of my station -- and that I have hereunto set my signature and affixed an impression of my seal of office,

figure.ab:
HUGH W. TENER
COMMISSIONER
OF DEEDS
PHILADELPHIA
PENNA:

body.p: Subscribed and Sworn to before me this 25th day of May A.D. 1861. Given under my hand and seal of office --

Theo D Rand
Commissioner of the State of Kentucky for the State of Pennsylvania residing in the City of Philadelphia.

figure.ab:
THEO D RAND
COMMISSIONER
OF DEEDS.
PHILADELPHIA.
PENNA.

body.p:
Pennsylvania
Comr. of Deeds
H.W Tener
Oath
Filed May 28' 1861
